title: Blaster Turret
summary: Small Turrets can only be equipped onto ships with S Turret Slots. Small ships such as Badger, Aurora, or Bison do not have S turret slots and cannot have S-turrets equipped. For the small autoturrets that some small ships have, see PDT.
full_text:
Blaster Turret
Small Turrets can only be equipped onto ships with S Turret Slots. Small ships such as Badger, Aurora, or Bison do not have S turret slots and cannot have S-turrets equipped. For the small autoturrets that some small ships have, see PDT.
Blaster Turrets
Blaster turrets are well-rounded , fast-firing energy-based turrets. These turrets have an average turn rate, average accuracy, and deal average damage. They have no buffs or debuffs against certain types of health. 
Blasters come in Tier 1, Tier 2, Tier 3, and an Exotic variant. The Blaster's Exotic variant is Hybrid. Hybrid Blasters must be crafted from Drone Cores, a Tier 3 Blaster, and a Hybrid Blaster blueprint dropped by high-tier Drones and Drone Factories. 
Blaster-M Turrets
Blaster-M turrets are very similar to their S variant. They have greater firepower and lower maneuverability. Medium turrets can only be equipped onto ships with Medium Turret Slots.
Blaster-M turrets can be Tier 1, Tier 2, Tier 3, or an Exotic variant. The Blaster-M's only Exotic variant is Hybrid. Hybrid Blaster-M turrets must be crafted from Drone Cores, a Tier 3 Beam-M turret, and a Hybrid Blaster-M blueprint dropped by high-tier Drones and Drone Factories.
Manufacturing
Manufacturing costs are listed as below:
Blaster
Tier 1
80 Korrelite, 60 Reknite, 40 Gellium
Tier 2
40 Axnit, 20 Narcor, Blaster I
Tier 3
20 Red Narcor, Blaster II
Hybrid
10 Drone core, 10 Power cell, Blaster III, Hybrid Blaster blueprint
Blaster-M
Tier 1
160 Korrelite, 120 Reknite, 80 Gellium
Tier 2
80 Axnit, 40 Nacor, Blaster-M I
Tier 3
40 Red Nacor, Blaster-M II
Hybrid
20 Drone core, 20 Power cell, Blaster-M III, Hybrid Blaster-M blueprint
